com.igormaznitsa.prol.data
Class Term

java.lang.Object
  com.igormaznitsa.prol.data.Term
Direct Known Subclasses:
Operator, OperatorContainer, TermFloat, TermInteger, TermStruct, Var
public class Term
extends java.lang.Object

It is the main core class for all objects in the engine which represent terms. The object can contain a text string which is its unique content.

Author:
Igor Maznitsa (igor.maznitsa@igormaznitsa.com)

forWrite

public java.lang.String forWrite()
Get the text representation of the term for write/1 predicate

Returns:
the string for of the term which can be used for write/1 predicate, must not return null

Equ

public boolean Equ(Term otherTerm)
Check that the term is equal to an other term. Variables in the terms will be changed in the operation.

Parameters:
otherTerm - the other term to be compared, must not be null
Returns:
true if both term are equal, else false (but terms can be changed after the operation)

asCharList

public TermList asCharList()
Encode the text representation of the term into TermList which contains chars of the text separately

Returns:
the generated char list as TermList object, must not be null

asCharCodeList

public TermList asCharCodeList()
Encode the text representation of the term into TermList which contains char codes of the text separately

Returns:
the generated char code list as TermList object, must not be null

termComparsion

public int termComparsion(Term atom)
To compare two terms, it is like prolog predicate '==' or '=\='

Returns:
0 if both term are equal, -1 if compared term has bigger order and 1 if compared term has lower order

hasAnyDifference

public boolean hasAnyDifference(Term comparedTerm)
To find any difference with other term

Returns:
true if compared term is not equal or false if equal

getTextLength

public int getTextLength()
Get the length of the text associated with the term

Returns:
the text length as integer

hasVariableWithName

public boolean hasVariableWithName(java.lang.String name)
Check whether it has such named variable

Parameters:
name - the variable name, must not be null
Returns:
true if the term contains such named variable or false if it hasn't

makeClone

public Term makeClone()
One from most important functions. The function clones a term

Returns:
cloned term and its content (not null)
